New Records: New Zealand's 21-run win was their fourth smallest victory by terms of runs against India in T20 internationals.
New Zealand's 176 was their seventh highest score against India in T20 international and It is their third highest total in Indian soil in T20is.
Arshdeep Singh went for 27 runs in the final over of the innings, the third-most expensive over by an Indian bowler in T20 internationals.

Arshdeep Singh conceded 51 runs - which was his second most runs conceded for India in One-day international and the joint fourth most runs-conceded by an Indian bowler against New Zealand in T20Is, jointly with Hardik Pandya when he conceded 51 runs at Wellington in 2019.

Daryl Mitchell hammered a 26-ball his fastest fifty for New Zealand in T20 international and the joint third fastest half-century by a New Zealand batsman against India in T20Is, jointly with Colin Munro.
60: Devon Conway and Glenn Phillips set up the third highest third-wicket partnership for New Zealand against India in T20 internationals.
68: Suryakumar Yadav and Hardik Pandya set up the second highest fourth-wicket partnership for India against New Zealand in T20Is.
Washington Sundar hammered a 25-ball third fastest fifty by an Indian batsman against New Zealand in T20Is after 23-balls half-century jointly held by KL Rahul and Rohit Sharma in 2020.
India's 155 was their second lowest score in a completed innings against New Zealand at their home venue in T20Is after their 79 at Nagpur in 2016.
Key Match Events: Daryl Mitchell hammered a 26-ball fastest fifty for New Zealand in T20 international.
Washington Sundar scored a 25-ball maiden fifty.
New Zealand scored 176-6 in 20 overs with top scorer by Daryl Mitchell hammered a unbeaten 59 off 30-balls.
India scored 155-9 in 20 overs with top scorer by Washington Sundar hammered a career-best 50 off 28-balls.
